definitions.definition: The faculty of uttering articulate sounds or words; the ability to speak or to use vocalizations to communicate.
definitions.example: It was hard to hear the sounds of his speech over the noise. He had a bad speech impediment.

definitions.definition: A session of speaking, especially a long oral message given publicly by one person.
definitions.example: The candidate made some ambitious promises in his campaign speech.
Her speech was soft and lilting.

definitions.definition: (grammar) Speech reported in writing; see direct speech, reported speech
To make a speech; to harangue.
